neighbors.name: Salt River Project Agricultural Improvement And Power District
neighbors.claims: The Salt River Project (SRP) is an agricultural improvement district and a political subdivision of the State of Arizona ([source](https://www.srpnet.com/assets/srpnet/pdf/doing-business/SRP-Preliminary-Official-Statement-2025-Series-C.pdf)). As a major utility, SRP has committed to adding 2,025 megawatts of utility-scale solar energy to its power system by 2025 ([source](https://media.srpnet.com/srp-to-more-than-double-its-utility-scale-solar-to-2025-megawatts-by-2025/)). The organization has established sustainability goals to reduce carbon intensity by 82% by 2035 and achieve net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 ([source](https://media.srpnet.com/srp-provides-progress-report-toward-2035-sustainability-goals/)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via corporate sustainability partnership channels to align project goals with SRP's integrated system planning.

citations.claim: Political subdivision of the State of Arizona
citations.title: SRP Preliminary Official Statement 2025 Series C

citations.claim: Committed to adding 2,025 MW of utility-scale solar by 2025
citations.title: SRP to more than double its utility-scale solar

citations.claim: Sustainability goals to reduce carbon intensity by 82% by 2035
citations.title: SRP provides progress report toward 2035 Sustainability Goals

neighbors.name: Kamala Hollon
neighbors.claims: Kamala Hollon is a resident of Arizona ([source](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/h/kamala-hollon/)). She was identified as a close friend of the late Scott Joseph Rogers in a 2024 obituary ([source](https://www.dignitymemorial.com/obituaries/phoenix-az/scott-rogers-11784949)). No public statements regarding renewable energy development were found.
neighbors.influence_justification: Private citizen; no public offices found.

approach_recommendations.engage: Use a friendly, one-on-one introduction by a community liaison to share project information and invite her feedback.

citations.claim: Identified as friend in Scott Rogers obituary
citations.title: Obituary for Scott Joseph Rogers

neighbors.name: Keith Ringler
neighbors.claims: Keith Ringler is a Phoenix-area resident and the brother of the late Charles Ringler ([source](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/azcentral/name/charles-ringler-obituary?id=26641928)). He was the longtime companion of Kimberly Townsend, who passed away in 2015 ([source](https://www.dignitymemorial.com/obituaries/glendale-az/kim-townsend-ringler-6714818)). He has been listed as a donor to St. Vincent de Paul ([source](https://www.stvincentdepaul.net/sites/default/files/Fall-Winter2016_Vincentian_Spreads.pdf)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Private citizen; no public offices found.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via personal outreach by a trusted community member, focusing on listening to his questions and addressing any concerns he may have.

citations.claim: Donor to St. Vincent de Paul
citations.title: Vincentian Connection Newsletter
